html:
Just a designer now: Shopify dropped UX as a title

Shopify has removed UX from their titles, but at what cost to user-centred design?

Uh, oh. Shopify just ignited another design debate. As of June 2025, they have removed UX from their titles.

Chief Design Officer Carl Rivera dropped the bombshell on X: “We just dropped UX as a title at @Shopify.”

UX Designers are now simply Designers.

The same logic applies to content designers. And if you write, well, you’re a writer. Simple, yes. But better — that’s up for debate.

The news spread quickly from X to LinkedIn. Reactions were mixed, with design Leader Andy Budd capturing the mood:

“Goodbye UX Design. It was fun while it lasted.”

It could be an overreaction, but these small shifts add up. And when they do, I start to wonder:

Is this just a title change or another quiet downgrade of UX? Are we moving forward or circling…
